review: The Amazon Fire HD does NOT come with several of the apps that make their competitor's models more value for the investment.  I would have gone with the Chrome one if I had known what I know now.  Perhaps the other apps will be introduced in the near future but it's a disappointment not to have them right now.  It's nice having the FREE movies from being a Prime Member but a lot of the ones I personally want to see, there is a rental charge.  Smoot marketing, Amazon
author: thynson

review: My hubs and I bought this as our xmas gift to each other - what a great purchase! I already had a Prime membership (and have for years), so this seemed like a no-brainer for getting quality programming without paying cable company prices. Amazon Fire TV with Prime membership offers most of the our cable company's "2nd tier" programming, as well as several premium cable series for free. After we played with this for a week or so, we told our cable company to cut us back to basic cable - and as a result we are saving about 300 dollars a year. Installs in about 5 minutes. My hubs wanted the voice search - I use the text search; both work well. My only complaint is that after a month of daily use I've noticed that the controller is sticking a bit. That may be because my husband uses it to play Amazon Prime free video games and that's probably hard on it; so if you want to use the Five TV to play video games, get the game controller (I now wish that I had done so). Easy to link your prime account to the device, but be mindful of one-click purchases: add a pin number when you register, to prevent accidental or "guest" charges to your account. I wound up paying for about 30 dollars worth of programs that would not have occurred if a pin number had been required before finalizing the purchase.
